intro: Sida elongata var. balica, commonly known as the Balic sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Asia and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pale green leaves. The plant produces clusters of five-petaled, yellowish-white flowers that bloom during the warm season. It is typically found in moist, sunny habitats such as grasslands and riverbanks. Its fibrous stems and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties.
